meanings.definition: To officially recognize or approve as meeting certain standards or requirements.
meanings.sent1: The school will accredit the new program after reviewing its quality.
meanings.sent2: The government agency will accredit the hospital to ensure it meets safety standards.
meanings.sent3: The detective jokingly accredits the missing cookies to the office ghost.
meanings.sent4: Her success can be accredited to her hard work and determination.
meanings.sent5: The badge will accredit you as an official member of the club.

meanings.definition: To give official authorization or status to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The university will accredit the student's degree upon completion.
meanings.sent2: The board will accredit the company to operate in the region.
meanings.sent3: The cat humorously accredits the broken vase to the dog's tail.
meanings.sent4: The crown accredits the knight as a protector of the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The certificate will accredit you as a qualified professional in the field.

meanings.definition: To attribute or ascribe something to a particular cause or source.
meanings.sent1: The scientist will accredit the discovery to years of research.
meanings.sent2: The author accredits the inspiration for the book to her travels.
meanings.sent3: The comedian playfully accredits the laughter in the room to his jokes.
meanings.sent4: The artist accredits the beauty of the painting to nature's colors.
meanings.sent5: The chef will accredit the delicious flavor of the dish to a secret ingredient.
